newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Rato says deficit reduction priority in 98.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Rato says deficit reduction priority in 98.

text.p: Spanish Economy Minister Rodrigo Rato said on Friday lowering the deficit will be a top objective in the 1998 budget.
"Deficit reduction is a clear priority ," Rato told a news conference following the weekly cabinet meeting.
Rato said the budget envisages a 3.4 percent increase in public expenditure. GDP is seen growing by 3.4 percent following an expected 3.2 percent increase in 1997.
Rato said real growth is expected to exceed inflation in both 1997 and 1998.
"Public expenditure will increase less than (GDP) in nominal terms," Rato said.
"In 1997 and 1998, the economy will grow above inflation in real terms," he added.
Rato predicted the budget would meet all its targets.
"The budget deviations of past years have vanished," he said.
